# Motivation {.vertical-center background-color=blue background-image="images/bg.jpg"}

> For something to change, sombebody somewhere has to start behaving differently—in other wordrs, all change is ultimately behavior change. *Chip Heath, american author*

:::{.notes}
This class is about theories and tools that may help you to lead change in different contexts. As to that, we will get to know a useful framework for understanding change as well as methods and tools that might help you to make changes you want to make but can't.
:::

## Reflect! {.unlisted .unnumbered .html-hidden .vertical-center background-color=black background-image="images/exercise.jpg"}

:::{.incremental}
- Did you set up an alarm to get up this morning?    
  *If so, did you hit snooze? Twice?*
- Have you ever been on diet?     
  *If so, did you have fun? Did you quit before reaching your goals?*
- Do you make sports as much as you think would be sufficiently worthy?
- Are you engaged in some kind of "bad" habit[^badHabit]?
:::

[^badHabit]: You have all the information you need to see its a bad behavior, yet your keep doing it anyway.
